com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn

Class NNInstanceConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.transcribers.nn.NNInstanceConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class NNInstanceConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stringable
    Container for basic configuration metadata for neural networks. Sub-classes may extend this for neural network implementations requiring other configuration metadata.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman
    See Also:
    ParametrisedNeuralNetwork

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int inputCount
      The number of input neurons in the network.
      java.lang.String name
      A name/identifier for the network.
      int neuronCount
      The total number of neurons in the network.
      int outputCount
      The number of output neurons in the network.
      int stepsPerStep
      If applicable, the number of simulation steps to perform for each request to apply input to the network and retrieve output, for example via VectorFunction.apply(double[]).
      int synapseCount
      The total number of synapses in the network.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NNInstanceConfig()
      Creates an uninitialised NNInstanceConfig.
      NNInstanceConfig(int neuronCount, int synapseCount, int inputCount, int outputCount, int stepsPerStep, java.lang.String name)
      Creates an NNInstanceConfig initialised with the given metadata.
      NNInstanceConfig(int neuronCount, int synapseCount, int inputCount, int outputCount, java.lang.String name)
      Creates an NNInstanceConfig initialised with the given metadata, and stepsPerStep set to 1.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
